meanings.definition: The quality or state of being quantitative.
meanings.sent1: Her research focused on the quantitativeness of data analysis.
meanings.sent2: Scientists rely on the quantitativeness of measurements to draw conclusions.
meanings.sent3: The quantitativeness of the experiment made it easy to compare results.
meanings.sent4: The quantitativeness of the survey revealed interesting trends.
meanings.sent5: The quantitativeness of the graph made it clear which data points were outliers.

meanings.definition: The property of having a measurable amount.
meanings.sent1: The quantitativeness of ingredients in a recipe is crucial for its success.
meanings.sent2: The quantitativeness of resources determines their availability for use.
meanings.sent3: His obsession with the quantitativeness of his collection of stamps was amusing to his friends.
meanings.sent4: The quantitativeness of time seemed to slow down during the boring lecture.
meanings.sent5: The quantitativeness of rainfall in the region varied greatly throughout the year.
